content.description: A scientist is interested in whether there is a linear relationship between the amount of mercury in a lake and the surface area of the lake. The scientist collected data on 22 lakes of a similar type selected at random and used the data to test the claim that there is a linear relationship. The following hypotheses were used to test the claim.
content.question: <math alttext="H sub 0: beta equals 0. H sub a: beta is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>β</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math> The test yielded a <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 2.086 with a corresponding <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.05. Which of the following is the correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: If there is a linear relationship between the amount of mercury in a lake and the surface area of the lake, the probability of observing a test statistic as extreme as 2.086 or more extreme is 0.05.
If there is a linear relationship between the amount of mercury in a lake and the surface area of the lake, the probability of observing a test statistic of 2.086 is 0.05.
If there is not a linear relationship between the amount of mercury in a lake and the surface area of the lake, the probability of observing a test statistic of 2.086 or greater is 0.05.
If there is not a linear relationship between the amount of mercury in a lake and the surface area of the lake, the probability of observing a test statistic of 2.086 is 0.05.

If there is not a linear relationship between the amount of mercury in a lake and the surface area of the lake, the probability of observing a test statistic as extreme as 2.086 or more extreme is 0.05.

content.answer: If there is not a linear relationship between the amount of mercury in a lake and the surface area of the lake, the probability of observing a test statistic as extreme as 2.086 or more extreme is 0.05.

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
